1. The training rule on six years

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū anuvassaṁ santhataṁ kārāpenti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū anuvassam santhatam kārāpenti
translated: the monks were having blankets made outside the rainy season.

analyzed: te yācana bahulāḥ viññatti bahulāḥ viharanti
translated: They were begging for thread and wool,
saying, “Please give thread.
We need thread.”
People complained and criticized them,

original: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā anuvassaṁ santhataṁ kārāpessanti, yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharissanti—
analyzed: katham hi nāma samaṇāḥ sakyaputtiyāḥ anuvassam santhatam kārāpessanti yācana bahulāḥ viññatti bahulāḥ viharissanti
translated: “How can the Sakyan monastics have blankets made outside the rainy season, begging for thread and wool,

analyzed: eḷaka lomāni detha eḷaka lomehi attha uti
translated: saying, ‘Please give thread. We need thread’?

original: Amhākaṁ pana sakiṁ katāni santhatāni pañcapi chapi vassāni honti, yesaṁ no dārakā uhadantipi ummihantipi undūrehipi khajjanti.
analyzed: amhākam pana sakim katāni santhatāni pañca api chapi vassāni honti yesam no dārakāḥ uhadanti pi ummihanti pi undūrehi pi khajjanti
translated: But our blankets last five or six years, and our children urinate and defecate on them and gnaw on them with their teeth.”

original: Ime pana samaṇā sakyaputtiyā anuvassaṁ santhataṁ kārāpenti, yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharanti—
analyzed: ime pana samaṇā sakya puttiyāḥ anuvassam santhatam kārāpenti yācana bahulāḥ viññatti bahulāḥ viharanti
translated: “These Sakyan monastics make robes for the rainy season throughout the year. They beg a lot and ask for a lot:

analyzed: eḷaka lomāni detha eḷaka lomehi attha uti
translated: ‘Please give wool. We need wool.’”

original: Assosuṁ kho bhikkhū tesaṁ manussānaṁ ujjhāyantānaṁ khiyyantānaṁ vipācentānaṁ.
analyzed: assosum kho bhikkhū tesam manussānam ujjhāyantānam khiyyantānam vipācentāna
translated: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

original: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
analyzed: ye te bhikkhū appicchā pe te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti
translated: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

original: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhū anuvassaṁ santhataṁ kārāpessanti, yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharissanti—
analyzed: katham hi nāma bhikkhū anuvassam santhatam kārāpessanti yācana bahulāḥ viññatti bahulāḥ viharissanti
translated: “How can monks make robes for the rainy season throughout the year? They beg a lot and ask for a lot:

original: ‘eḷakalomāni detha, eḷakalomehi attho’”ti.🔽Atha kho te bhikkhū te anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ …pe…
analyzed: eḷaka lomāni detha eḷaka lomehi attha uti  atha kho te bhikkhū te aneka pariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etam attham ārocesuṃ pe
translated: ‘Please give wool. We need wool.’”

original: “saccaṁ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhū anuvassaṁ santhataṁ kārāpenti, yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharanti—
analyzed: saccam kira bhikkhave bhikkhū anuvassam santhatam kārāpenti yācana bahulāḥ viññatti bahulāḥ viharanti
translated: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:

analyzed: eḷaka lomāni detha eḷaka lomehi attha uti
translated: “Is it true, monks, that monks are doing this?”
“It’s true, Sir.”
The Buddha, the Blessed One, rebuked them, …

original: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā anuvassaṁ santhataṁ kārāpessanti, yācanabahulā viññattibahulā viharissanti—
analyzed: katham hi nāma te bhikkhave moghapurisāḥ anuvassam santhatam kārāpessanti yācana bahulāḥ viññatti bahulāḥ viharissanti
translated: “How can those foolish men have a mat made every year, asking for a lot and demanding a lot?

analyzed: eḷaka lomāni detha eḷaka lomehi attha uti
translated: ‘Give wool. I need wool.’

analyzed: na ita bhikkhave appasannānam vā pasādāya pe
translated: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …

original: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave imam sikkhāpadam uddiseyyātha
translated: And, monks, this is how you should recite the training rule:

original: “Navaṁ pana bhikkhunā santhataṁ kārāpetvā chabbassāni dhāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: navam pana bhikkhunā santhatam kārāpetvā cha bassāni dhāretabba
translated: ‘When a monk has a new mat made, he should keep it for six years.

original: Orena ce channaṁ vassānaṁ taṁ santhataṁ vissajjetvā vā avissajjetvā vā aññaṁ navaṁ santhataṁ kārāpeyya, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyan”ti.
analyzed: orena ce channam vassānam tam santhatam vissajjetvā vā a vissajjetvā vā aññam navam santhatam kārāpeyya nissaggiyam pācittiyan ti
translated: If he discards it after six years or has it discarded and then makes a new one, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

original: Evañcidaṁ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ paññattaṁ hoti.🔽Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu kosambiyaṁ gilāno hoti.
analyzed: evañca idam bhagavatā bhikkhūnam sikkhāpadam paññattam hoti  tena kho pana samayena aññataraḥ bhikkhu kosambiyam gilānaḥ hoti
translated: And so this training rule for monks was set forth by the Buddha.🔽On one occasion a monk was sick at Kosambī.

original: Ñātakā tassa bhikkhuno santike dūtaṁ pāhesuṁ—
analyzed: ñātakā tassa bhikkhuno santike dūtam pāhesu
translated: His relatives sent a message to him, saying,
“Come, Venerable, we’ll look after you.”
The monks said,

analyzed: gaccha āvuso ñātakā tam upaṭṭhahissanti iti
translated: “Go, friend. Your relatives will look after you.”

analyzed: sā u evam āha  bhagavatā āvuso sikkhāpadam paññatta
translated: He replied,

original: ‘navaṁ pana bhikkhunā santhataṁ kārāpetvā chabbassāni dhāretabban’ti.
analyzed: navam pana bhikkhunā santhatam kārāpetvā cha bassāni dhāretabbanti
translated: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule that you should keep a new sitting mat for six years.

original: Ahañcamhi gilāno, na sakkomi santhataṁ ādāya pakkamituṁ.
analyzed: aham ca amhi gilānaḥ na sakkomi santhatam ādāya pakkamitu
translated: But I’m sick and can’t travel with my sitting mat.

original: Mayhañca vinā santhatā na phāsu hoti.
translated: And I’m not comfortable without my sitting mat.
I won’t go.”
They told the Buddha.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave gilānassa bhikkhuno santhata sammutim dātu
translated: “Monks, I allow you to give permission to a sick monk to use a sitting mat.
And it should be given like this.

original: Tena gilānena bhikkhunā saṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā vuḍḍhānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṁ nisīditvā añjaliṁ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
analyzed: tena gilānena bhikkhunā saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā vuḍḍhānam bhikkhūnam pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikam nisīditvā añjalim paggahetvā evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: The sick monk should then approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
‘Venerables, I’m sick.
I’m unable to travel with my sitting mat.

original: Sohaṁ, bhante, saṅghaṁ santhatasammutiṁ yācāmī’ti.🔽Dutiyampi yācitabbā.
analyzed: sā uha bhante saṅgham santhata sammutim yācāmi iti  dutiyam pi yācitabbā
translated: I ask the Sangha for permission to use a mat.’
He should ask a second and a third time.
An experienced and competent monk should then inform the Sangha:
‘Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.🔽This monk so-and-so is sick.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu gilāno na sakkoti santhataṁ ādāya pakkamituṁ.
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu gilānaḥ na sakkoti santhatam ādāya pakkamitu
translated: He’s unable to travel with his sitting mat.
He’s asking the Sangha for permission to use a mat.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno santhatasammutiṁ dadeyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa pattakalla saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno santhata sammutim dadeyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give permission to monk so-and-so to use a mat.
This is the motion.
Venerables, may the Sangha listen to me.🔽This monk so-and-so is sick.

original: Ayaṁ itthannāmo bhikkhu gilāno na sakkoti santhataṁ ādāya pakkamituṁ.
analyzed: ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikkhu gilānaḥ na sakkoti santhatam ādāya pakkamitu
translated: He’s unable to travel with his sitting mat.
He’s asking the Sangha for permission to use it.

original: Saṅgho itthannāmassa bhikkhuno santhatasammutiṁ deti.🔽Yassāyasmato khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno santhatasammutiyā dānaṁ, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: saṅghaḥ itthannāmassa bhikkhuno santhata sammutim deti  yassa ayasmataḥ khamati itthannāmassa bhikkhuno santhata sammutiyā so tuṇhassa
translated: The Sangha gives permission to monk so-and-so to use it.🔽Any monk who approves of giving permission to monk so-and-so to use it should remain silent.
Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

analyzed: dinnā saṅghena itthannāmassa bhikkhuno santhata sammuti
translated: The Sangha has given permission to monk so-and-so to use it.
Since there is silence, the Sangha approves.
I will remember it thus.”

original: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṁ sikkhāpadaṁ uddiseyyātha—
analyzed: evam ca pana bhikkhave imam sikkhāpadam uddiseyyātha
translated: And, monks, you should recite this training rule like this:

original: “Navaṁ pana bhikkhunā santhataṁ kārāpetvā chabbassāni dhāretabbaṁ.
analyzed: navam pana bhikkhunā santhatam kārāpetvā cha bassāni dhāretabba
translated: ‘If a monk has a new blanket made, he must keep it for six years.

original: Orena ce channaṁ vassānaṁ taṁ santhataṁ vissajjetvā vā avissajjetvā vā aññaṁ navaṁ santhataṁ kārāpeyya, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyan”ti.
analyzed: orena ce channam vassānam tam santhatam vissajjetvā vā a vissajjetvā vā aññam navam santhatam kārāpeyya aññatra bhikkhu sammutiyā nissaggiyam pācittiyan ti
translated: If he disposes of that blanket after fewer than six years, whether by taking it, by having it taken, by giving it away, or by throwing it away, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession, except if the monks have agreed.’”
New:
it is said with reference to the making.
Blanket:
it is made by sewing together.
Has made:
Has made or has had made:

original: Chabbassāni dhāretabbanti🔽chabbassaparamatā dhāretabbaṁ.🔽Orena ce channaṁ vassānanti
analyzed: cha bassāni dhāretabbanti  dhāretabba  orena ce channam
translated: Should be kept for six years:🔽It should be kept for a maximum of six years.🔽If it is less than six years:
If it is less than six years.
That used sitting mat should be relinquished:
It should be given to others.
If he does not relinquish it:
If he does not give it to anyone.
Except if the monks agree:

original: ṭhapetvā bhikkhusammutiṁ aññaṁ navaṁ santhataṁ karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṁ.
analyzed: ṭhapetvā bhikkhu sammutim aññam navam santhatam karoti vā kārāpeti vā payoge dukkaṭa
translated: unless the monks have agreed, if he makes a new sitting mat or has one made, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
When he gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

original: Nissajjitabbaṁ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
analyzed: nissajjitabbam saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā
translated: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

original: “idaṁ me, bhante, santhataṁ ūnakachabbassāni kārāpitaṁ, aññatra bhikkhusammutiyā, nissaggiyaṁ.
analyzed: idam me bhante santhatam ūnaka chabbassāni aññatra bhikkhu sammutiyā
translated: ‘Venerables, this sitting mat, which I have made in less than six years and which I have not relinquished, is to be relinquished.

analyzed: imā aham saṅghassa nissajjāmi iti pe  dadeyyā ati pe
translated: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …🔽‘Give it to me.’ …
‘Give it to him.’ …
‘I give it to you.’

original: Attanā vippakataṁ attanā pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.
analyzed: attanā vippakatam attanā pariyosāpeti nissaggiyam pācittiya
translated: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: Attanā vippakataṁ parehi pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.🔽Parehi vippakataṁ attanā pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.
analyzed: attanā vippakatam parehi pariyosāpeti nissaggiyam pācittiya  parehi vippakatam attanā pariyosāpeti nissaggiyam pācittiya
translated: If he finishes what he has started himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽If he finishes what others have started, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: Parehi vippakataṁ parehi pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṁ pācittiyaṁ.
analyzed: parehi vippakatam parehi pariyosāpeti nissaggiyam pācittiya
translated: If he finishes what others have started, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
There is no offense if🔽he makes it for six years;
if he makes it for more than six years;

analyzed: aññassa atthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā
translated: if he makes it or has one made for the benefit of someone else;
if he gets one made by another and then uses it;

original: vitānaṁ vā bhūmattharaṇaṁ vā sāṇipākāraṁ vā bhisiṁ vā bibbohanaṁ vā karoti,
analyzed: vitānam vā bhūmattharaṇam vā sāṇi pākāram vā bhisim vā bibbohanam vā karoti
translated: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;
if he makes it with the approval of the Sangha;
if he is insane;
if he is the first offender.🔽The training rule on six years, the fourth, is finished.
